helpers.rpd: Number of API requests per day.
helpers.rpm: Number of API requests per minute.
helpers.spu: Maximum number of short URLs a user can create.
helpers.smtp: This mail server is used for password recovery, sending first access invitations, and other communications generated by the platform.
helpers.smtp-test: Send a test message to the admin's email to verify the app's functionality
helpers.smtp-ssl: If true, the connection will use TLS when connecting to the server. If false (the default), TLS is used if the server supports the STARTTLS extension. In most cases, set this value to true if you are connecting to port 465. For port 587 or 25, keep it false
helpers.watchlists: Watchlists affect user registration and detail updates, while banning domains will prevent URL shortening.
helpers.add-whitelist: Allow an email or domain across the platform.
helpers.add-blacklist: Block an email or domain across the platform.
helpers.vt-api: Scans the domain using the VirusTotal API. Snapp checks the domain reputation and blocks any site with a negative score. Positive or neutral scores will allow the domain. Requests are cached for 24 hours.

helpers.signups: Allow external signups from the front-end.
helpers.homepage: Redirect users to login or dashboard instead.
helpers.http: Allow URLs with HTTP instead of HTTPS.

helpers.forgot-password: Enter your email to start password recovery.
helpers.recover-password: This will trigger a password reset email to this account.
helpers.set-new-password: Set up a password for your account.

auth.go-to-signup: Don't have an account? Register at the signup page.
auth.go-to-signin: Already have an account? Go to the login page.
auth.reset-email-sent: Password recovery started, an email has been sent to the address provided.
auth.post-email-message: We sent an email to the address you provided.

helpers.invitation: The user will receive an email invitation to set up their password.
helpers.notes: Notes are visible to admins only in the user overview page.
helpers.max-snapps: Limit the number of snapps this user can create.
helpers.password: Password must be at least eight characters long, with at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character.

actions.confirm-delete: This action will delete the user and their content permanently.

tokens.label: API REST Token
tokens.placeholder: Your API Key will appear here...
tokens.helper: Authorize API calls with an Authorization Header bearing the generated Token. API Keys are unique and relate to the user account, sharing database roles.
tokens.api-docs: Refer to the complete API Docs for usage and implementation details.
tokens.not-allowed-to-copy: Browser Clipboard requires a secure HTTPS environment.

migrations.label: Migration
migrations.csv-file-required: Import requires a valid Snapp CSV file
migrations.requires-time: All the snapps will be exported. This action may requires some time.

placeholders.secret: Specify a secret to protect your url
placeholders.search: Search by original url or shortcode

labels.open-link: Open Snapp in a new window

helpers.create: You can specify a custom short-url. If left empty it will be autogenerated
helpers.original-url: This must be a valid https:// link
helpers.shortcode: This will be generated if a custom is not specified
helpers.secret: This URL is protected by a secret
helpers.provide-secret: Please provide the correct password to continue
helpers.text-pasted: Original URL has been pasted from clipboard
helpers.has-secret: Specify a Secret to protect the URL from unwanted access
helpers.expiration: Specify an expiration date to auto-disable your url
helpers.max-usages: Specify a limited amount of usages for this snapp. After reaching the limit the snapp will be disabled
helpers.previous-expiration: This Snapp has already an expiration set, expiring {relativeTime}
helpers.previous-secret: This Snapp has already a secret set
helpers.disable-text-1: Pause this snapp. Its data, the selected short code, and display data will be preserved. The user will receive a disambiguation message explaining that the redirect is temporarily unavailable.
helpers.disable-text-2: Also when a snapp get used for the set number of times, it get disabled by default. It can be re-enabled from here.

actions.created: The URL have been successfully Snapp'd
actions.confirm-delete: This action will delete the snapp permanently.

auth.email-invalid: Please provide a valid email address.
auth.email-registered: This email is already associated with an account. Try signing up or recovering your password.
auth.disabled-signups: Signups are disabled. If you think this is a mistake, please contact the service administrator.
auth.password-invalid: The password provided is not secure enough. Please try again.
auth.password-unmatch: Password and confirmation password do not match.
auth.username-invalid: Username is invalid. Please provide at least a three-character long name for your profile.
auth.user-already-exists: Username already taken. Please try another one.
auth.reset-token-expired: Password recovery reset token has expired.

snapps.unallowed-not-https: The original URL must be a secure https link
snapps.original-url-missing: An Original URL must be provided for redirection
snapps.original-url-blacklisted: This URL has been blacklisted or flagged by VirusTotal API
snapps.missing-secret: You must provide a secret to access this URL
snapps.wrong-credentials: The secret you provide doesn't match the one to unlock the URL
snapps.max-snapps: You reached the limit of snapp that an account can create
snapps.disabled: This Snapp is disabled, by the owner or after reaching a set threeshold. If you think this is a mistake try contact administrator

blacklisted.user: There was an issue with your authentication process. Please contact the service administrator.
blacklisted.domain: This snapp redirects to a blacklisted domain. Please contact the service administrator if you think this is a mistake.

errors.generic: An error occurred. If this persists, contact the administrator.
errors.unauthorized: You are not allowed to do this
errors.label: Error

homepage.intro: If you're seeking a self-hosted URL shortening solution, Snapp might be what you need. It's designed for those who value control over their URL management and want to explore various technologies.

ui.label: User Friendly Interface
ui.description: Snapp provides a user-friendly interface for seamless link shortening. Read how to get started!

auth.label: Secure Authentication
auth.description: Enjoy a secure experience for your user sessions.

shortcode.label: Custom Short URLs
shortcode.description: Create personalized short codes for your links to make them memorable and easy to share.

expiration.label: Expire your URLs
expiration.description: Create personalized short codes for your links to make them memorable and easy to share.

secrecy.label: Protected URLs
secrecy.description: Add an extra layer of protection with secret links. Choose to share links with a selected audience using unique secrets.

analytics.label: Analytics
analytics.description: Empower yourself with detailed analytics for every link you create. Snapp gathers metrics anonymously, providing insights into link engagements and respecting your users privacy.

umami.label: Umami Integration
umami.description: Integrate your Snapp Instance with your self-hosted or cloud <a href={url} class="link">Umami Analytics<a> instance for advanced metrics of your Snapps.

vtapi.label: VirusTotal API Integration
vtapi.description: Secure the links passing through your Snapp instance with a check on VirusTotal API reputation.

rest-api.label: REST API
rest-api.description: Community requested features that enables API Rest endpoint to create and manage your Snapps remotely. Read full Swagger documentation here

getting-started.label: Getting started
getting-started.claim: Snapp is a self-hostable open source platform

docker.label: Using Docker Container
docker.helper: Use this docker-compose.yml to run your Snapp

migration.label: Migration
migration.description: Latest versions of Snapp included CSV Export in order to facilitate migration. Simply login and import your urls from dashboard, and continue from where you left.
